result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Mario Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Mario Peterson

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Case Letter

09:52 AM Defendant Anthony Mario Peterson in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Anthony Mario Peterson in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State recites joint agreement that defendant plead to Counts 1 and 3. Count 2 to be dismissed but read in. For Count 1, 60 days jail with 18 days credit and pay a $50 fine plus court costs. Concurrent to Count 3. For Count 3, 60 days and pay a $50 fine plus court costs. Concurrent to Count 1. Defedant pleads no contest. Attorney Hansen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. 

Court imposes for Count 1, 60 days jail with 18 days credit and pay a $50 fine plus court costs. Concurrent to Count 3. For Count 3, 60 days with credit for 18 days. Concurrent to Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in. 120 days to pay.

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription; within 24 hours of release, defendant must update address with the Clerk of Court.

01:32 PM Defendant Anthony Mario Peterson in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Anthony Mario Peterson in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading plead not guilty on misdemeanor charges.  States request on bail: $2500 cash bail   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State indicates Defendant was sentenced last week on fleeing on motor vehicle. Defendant was given $2000 cash bail but defendant was in custody. Defendant was given $2500 cash bail and less than 18 hours of being released from jail he was arrested. State gives extensive criminal history. 
Atty Hoffman asserts Defendant does have family and local ties. Defendant is on a probation hold. Defendant does not have any money to post.
Court orders $2000 cash bond with conditions of  no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription; within 24 hours of release, defendant must update address with the Clerk of Court.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
